intro: Verbascum boerhavii var. portae, commonly known as the Porta's mullein, is a variant of the mullein plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, gray-green leaves that are covered in soft hairs. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late summer, typically arranged in clusters at the top of the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in rocky or dry habitats. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
